data.text:
Food safety is everyone's business!

On Monday's #WorldFoodSafetyDay, watch how you can keep your food safe at home. 

More on how @WFP works to ensure food safety around the world: https://t.co/khNB7QYii1 https://t.co/qEZN0vEikK

Amid #COVID19, misinformation is causing global harm and can be deadly.

Take time to verify facts before you share something online to stop the spread of misinformation — and the virus. #TakeCareBeforeYouShare https://t.co/9cNARGlEUN https://t.co/JmkMrBBAGH

Food safety is everyone's business and can:

☑️ prevent foodborne illnesses,
☑️ promote healthy diets & lifestyles,
☑️ reduce food loss & waste,
and more! 

On Monday's #WorldFoodSafety @FAO has food safety tips. https://t.co/MeHUAPp4IX https://t.co/kjGd3Wvg2C

Portugal provides military & police officers to four @UNPeacekeeping missions around the world. 

We thank these brave women & men for #ServingForPeace, including amid the challenging conditions caused by the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/lZYeCoS6BZ https://t.co/qUOI9WCjBY

Monday is #WorldFoodSafetyDay. 

Safe food can help improve:
🍎 health & nutrition,
📚 school attendance,
💰 earning potential. 

More about the importance of safe food from @FAO: https://t.co/8FBgbTMJHP https://t.co/M3V89Kuvpt

40 years since the first AIDS case was reported, HIV remains a threat, including for many vulnerable groups.

Latest from @UNAIDS, including new data on countries' efforts to end the epidemic: https://t.co/B2ZdcPxKHm https://t.co/su6356c4Tb

Unsafe food kills an estimated 420,000 people every year.

On Monday's #WorldFoodSafetyDay, @FAO explains why food safety is everyone’s business. https://t.co/8FBgbTMJHP https://t.co/uuIJHa7m0h

Taking #ClimateAction and living more sustainably doesn't have to be difficult.

The #ActNow app helps you reduce your carbon footprint - and have fun doing it. https://t.co/4i2kqgYQPL https://t.co/0sU3oyZEws

Human rights are for everyone, everywhere - no matter who you are or whom you love. 

🖤🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜

This #PrideMonth, join UN @free_equal in the fight against transphobia, homophobia & biphobia: https://t.co/Ljui9G92Ag #StandUp4HumanRights https://t.co/Ozr6noD6q8

We need to restore our ecosystems to tackle the #ClimateCrisis, save species from extinction, improve air & water quality, protect human health & mitigate extreme weather. 

More on #GenerationRestoration from @UNEP. 
https://t.co/7fEqXnllc9

The health of our planet's ecosystems is critical to life on Earth.  

We need to #ActNow & take urgent #ClimateAction to protect our planet, improve the lives of people around the world & achieve the #GlobalGoals. https://t.co/6gN3jgSapl https://t.co/a3x1HTI4DC

Drones are providing vital medical supplies to women in remote parts of Botswana.

The innovative initiative, supported by @UNFPA, is helping to save women who may otherwise die in childbirth. https://t.co/3ouOoNXSgI

В воскресенье ООН отмечает День русского языка.

Sunday is Russian Language Day!

Follow @UnitedNationsRU for updates on the UN's work in Russian. https://t.co/1dmkmFoD6A

The UN #PalJournos programme is an opportunity for Palestinian journalists looking for international experience & new skills. 

Apply by 22 June: https://t.co/wsJiyLoO9O https://t.co/ED6DVx3LFg

"We are stronger when we work, heal, learn & grow together. The stories of people forced to flee are our stories too."

-- @Refugees communications chief, @JAGhedini, on how @HandmaidsOnHulu storylines reflect painful realities for many displaced people. https://t.co/MUAhrS8m8n

📚 Learning
🌟 Dreaming
🧸 Playing
That's what all kids should do. 

But millions of girls & boys are trapped in child labour & #COVID19 has deteriorated the situation even further. 

2021 is the International Year to #EndChildLabour. https://t.co/EE3f6tenVi via @ILO https://t.co/cO1GStJDzh

Addressing the climate crisis requires ecosystem restoration, alongside rapid de-carbonization. 

On Saturday's #WorldEnvironmentDay, join #GenerationRestoration and raise your voice with @UNEP. https://t.co/K653woQ6gy https://t.co/N3Tm3yurXp

"Misinformation is prolonging the pandemic, and all the suffering that goes with it."

-- UN communications chief @MelissaFleming explains how countering misinformation is key to defeating #COVID19.
https://t.co/DLy9gUAk1U

From planting trees 🌳, to cleaning up riverbanks 🏞 and beaches 🏖, everyone can do something to help restore ecosystems & heal our planet. 

On Saturday's #WorldEnvironmentDay, join #GenerationRestoration with @UNEP: https://t.co/YbE1FOk5zL https://t.co/PBE4v7j0l7

Fisheries provide a vital source of food, employment, recreation, trade & economic well-being for people around the world. 

On Saturday's Day of Illegal, Unreported & Unregulated Fishing, @FAO explains how this practice threatens the health of our ocean. https://t.co/OkGG1Ejd47 https://t.co/xoMXbYi4Pl

"Let today be the start of a new decade – one in which we finally make peace with nature & secure a better future for all." 
-- @antonioguterres at launch of Decade on Ecosystem Restoration. 

Join #GenerationRestoration on Saturday's #WorldEnvironmentDay! https://t.co/bOZyPbvRwF https://t.co/Wu2hdovYo0

Sustainable fishing is needed to #SaveOurOcean & protect the livelihoods of millions of people.

On Saturday's Day of Illegal, Unreported & Unregulated Fishing, see how @FAO is helping to end this harmful practice. https://t.co/BgyRUCE0En https://t.co/9gvHpFYbCL

People & planet are only as healthy as the ecosystems we all depend on.

On Saturday's #WorldEnvironmentDay, @UNEP explains how we can restore ecosystems to tackle the climate crisis, save species from extinction & secure our future. #GenerationRestoration https://t.co/K653woQ6gy

Getting #COVID19 vaccines help:
🦠 slow the spread of the pandemic
👥👥 protect our loved ones & communities.

#OnlyTogether can we overcome this crisis— by sharing the vaccine fairly around the world. https://t.co/SVtXYeh42c https://t.co/EmPp2X1s7N

The next 10 years will be critical for addressing the climate crisis.

The Decade on Ecosystem Restoration was launched on Friday as a rallying call for the protection & revival of ecosystems around the world. #GenerationRestoration
https://t.co/CdG2Im6GR8

.@UNEP chief @andersen_inger warns of catastrophic environmental impacts if oil tanker disabled off the coast of Yemen begins to leak or explodes.

UN prepared to conduct assessment mission to examine the condition of the tanker & avert potential disaster. https://t.co/jLHcQu4XMd

Ensuring equitable vaccine access and donating medical equipment are just some of the acts of solidarity that help people around the world tackle the #COVID19 crisis.  

See more inspiring examples in our @TwitterMoments: https://t.co/d3YTs0M8hV

"When we respect nature & our planet, we are respecting ourselves."

Ahead of Saturday's #WorldEnvironmentDay, listen to @UNEP chief @andersen_inger talking about the power and importance of individual #ClimateAction on Awake At Night.🎧: https://t.co/q72SPKpcVX https://t.co/9xDeJuFZ1e

Children need peace & protection. They are #NotATarget. 

Friday's International Day of Innocent Children Victims of Aggression affirms the UN's commitment to children's rights. https://t.co/L0bZnV7gDf https://t.co/C3oqXut0zn

Ahead of next week's #WorldOceansDay, discover innovative solutions for the sustainable use of oceans, seas & marine resources in this new virtual exhibit:
https://t.co/tSTUa55wX6 https://t.co/CgCo25nAgE

Staff, delegates & more took part in a special #WorldBicycleDay event at UNHQ on Thursday! 

From improving health & fitness to supporting #ClimateAction, bicycles benefit people & 🌏.  https://t.co/4QSs2moNuR https://t.co/RnLowsf4iP

Tremendous progress has been made in combatting the AIDS epidemic over the last 40 years. 

Deaths have fallen thanks to antiretroviral therapy & 75% of all people living with HIV are receiving treatment. 

Latest from @UNAIDS: https://t.co/B2ZdcPxKHm https://t.co/ajt3hKP26N

The world must deliver on its commitment to restore at least 1 billion degraded hectares of land in the next decade to tackle the #ClimateCrisis, save species from extinction & secure our future

More on #GenerationRestoration from @UNEP: 
https://t.co/7fEqXnCW3H https://t.co/WwzX27dN4k

On Thursday's #WorldBicycleDay & every day, the UN is supporting the use of bicycles to transform mobility, including amid the #COVID19 pandemic, while also helping to create a greener, more sustainable post-crisis future. https://t.co/4QSs2moNuR https://t.co/GjeDBu5gLW

1/3 of our food is lost or wasted.

Be a #ClimateAction Superhero and help protect our planet by buying 'ugly' fruit & vegetables, purchasing local foods, learning how to best store food, eating leftovers & composting. https://t.co/nAjeCApKJ4 #ActNow https://t.co/iQeOqwRoc5

For more than 100 years, bicycles have helped advance women's rights by increasing their access to education, health care & sport. 

Thursday is #WorldBicycleDay. https://t.co/4QSs2moNuR https://t.co/lgugtOUiBt

🚲 = clean transportation
🚲 = #ClimateAction
🚲 = access to education & health care 
🚲 = improved health & fitness

More about how bicycles benefit people & 🌏 on Thursday's #WorldBicycleDay: https://t.co/4QSs2moNuR via @UNDP https://t.co/qo7cPBBqxU

“We cannot allow corruption to continue.”

Corruption corrodes public trust, weakens rule of law, seeds conflict, destabilizes peacebuilding efforts, undermines human rights, and impedes progress towards #GlobalGoals, @UN_PGA tells #UNGA. https://t.co/fhvflzHvH8

🚴‍♀️🚴‍♂️ Thursday is #WorldBicycleDay! 

Learn more about the benefits of bikes, which are used around the world as simple, affordable & efficient modes of sustainable transport. https://t.co/4QSs2moNuR #ClimateAction https://t.co/thGn6tAlpO

"Every country, every city, and every industry must come on board."

-- @antonioguterres calls for a global coalition for net-zero greenhouse gas emissions by mid-century. https://t.co/kbBudqCUAH https://t.co/6OXFZyKcpt

Every one of us can take #ClimateAction to help address the climate emergency. 

Join @UNEP's #GenerationRestoration snap challenge ahead of #WorldEnvironmentDay and show us how you will make a difference https://t.co/sUVld4yDUx

#UNGA special session on preventing & combating corruption is opportunity to advance fight against corruption to create more stable societies, advance public trust & promote sustainable development.
https://t.co/XtcedRcIlO https://t.co/pqnD7iw5Ef

“I wanted to educate my daughter and couldn’t -- that’s when I started to think of a solution.”

A group of mothers in a remote community in Egypt have come together to secure a better future for their children. 

Read how @WFP supported them. ⬇️

https://t.co/ku8SPz1C68

"Clear, transformative & actionable solutions to address the ocean crisis must be found & must be scaled up. Simply speaking, our relationship with our planet’s ocean must change."

-- @UN_PGA tells #UNGA. 
https://t.co/HxYrg7OxZN

The worldwide response to #COVID19 has demonstrated the power of solidarity. People are spreading kindness through their words & deeds -- while inspiring others to do the same.

No act of goodwill is too small in the fight against the pandemic.

🎨: Nat Bullard https://t.co/Bzb8ggtiwa

Countries are being urged to support $50 billion plan to end #COVID19 pandemic & drive a faster recovery.

UN-backed roadmap would scale-up availability of vaccines, tests & treatments in developing countries. https://t.co/j049aP97Lz

#LGBTIQ+ rights = HUMAN rights

This #PrideMonth, join UN @free_equal in the fight against transphobia & homophobia. https://t.co/9opL2WuLVd https://t.co/GuVcTXOBs0

We can get to net zero greenhouse gas emissions to limit global temperature rise & tackle the climate crisis if we take urgent #ClimateAction now. 

In every part of the world, cities, businesses, investors & educators are rallying behind the #RaceToZero. https://t.co/MSAJURN6nQ https://t.co/jYW7wE1Ynf

On Tuesday's Global Day of Parents, @UNICEF has tips on how to talk to your children about #COVID19 vaccines & help them understand how #VaccinesWork. 

https://t.co/9MMl4CCspu

Estonia assumes the rotating presidency of the Security Council for the month of June. 

Follow @EstoniaUN for updates. https://t.co/IOYj5nGsLC https://t.co/X0HCyMF4Ue

Parents & caregivers have faced unique & formidable challenges during the #COVID19 pandemic

On Tuesday's Global Day of Parents, here's a reminder to all parents of the importance of looking after yourself during these difficult times. https://t.co/klRzCVBpQx https://t.co/kokglwTztz

#COVID19 has been a major challenge for everyone, and educators are no exception.

There is an urgent need to invest in training for educators, so they can contribute to the pandemic recovery, says @ILO. https://t.co/IlpD89Y4cT

Tuesday is the Global Day of Parents. 

As families have borne the brunt of the #COVID19 pandemic, family-friendly workplace practices & stronger childcare policies are needed more than ever. https://t.co/klRzCVBpQx https://t.co/JbBc0INWId

Abuse is not always physical and it doesn’t always leave visible scars.

As #MentalHealthMonth comes to an end, @UN_Women has more on how to spot the signs of abuse & support women and girls amid the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/8ZEu3j9WR4 https://t.co/co4b5TtNr0

Every year, more than 8 million people die from tobacco.

There is no better time to #CommitToQuit!

More from @WHO on Monday's World #NoTobacco Day. https://t.co/KPMYDjvA4g https://t.co/hxupuIcPYs

For children facing both #COVID19 & armed violence, a lack of safe water can be life-threatening.

@UNICEF is calling for immediate action to improve children’s access to clean drinking water to save lives in conflicts & crises. https://t.co/AxudXGvPly

Tobacco is expensive! 💰 Smokers burn through an average of $1.4 million.

#CommitToQuit today to save money, while also safeguarding your health & protecting those around you. 

Monday is World #NoTobacco Day. https://t.co/KPMYDjdYFG via @WHO https://t.co/YwCSMYYPfM

#COVID19 has disrupted our lives, but it has not stopped the climate crisis. 
Delaying #ClimateAction costs livelihoods & lives.

Starting this Monday, countries are meeting virtually to prepare for success at #COP26, the UN Climate Conference. https://t.co/BcEtyzmHIv via @UNFCCC https://t.co/wsTmIOuHi7

Monday is World #NoTobacco Day 🚭.

The #COVID19 pandemic has led to millions of tobacco users saying they want to protect their health and quit tobacco.

Join them! https://t.co/KPMYDjdYFG https://t.co/grA08KJYKu

Ahead of the #GenerationEquality Forum, @UN_Women is showcasing young leaders & their activism.

Join us during the #ActforEqual week as these inspiring voices share what the Forum means to them & the future of gender equality. 

https://t.co/i83aL3z301 https://t.co/3hHEEQUKbv

The tobacco epidemic is one of the world's largest, yet preventable, public health threats, resulting in more than 8 million deaths a year. 

More from @WHO on Monday's World #NoTobacco Day. https://t.co/KPMYDjvA4g https://t.co/NkvThj6DTc

Holocaust distortion fuels antisemitism, racism, hatred & other dangerous forms of nationalism. 

We can all do our part to #ProtectTheFacts about the Holocaust. https://t.co/uJ3Y1F7isI https://t.co/8gXEpXg3Yn

"Let’s work together for a sustainable and equitable future for all people on a healthy planet."

-- @antonioguterres calls for a global partnership for green, inclusive, sustainable development. https://t.co/OG5puxZj2r https://t.co/xQp17BwCsi

Amid #COVID19, misinformation is causing global harm and can be deadly.

Take time to verify facts before you share something online to stop the spread of misinformation — and the virus. #TakeCareBeforeYouShare https://t.co/LV9n3DFvZe https://t.co/rXcac7N3Bc

"Being a medical officer in a @UNPeacekeeping mission demands a very high degree of alertness, preparedness & discipline."

-- 27-year-old Lieutenant Hinasha Thapa from Nepal is #ServingForPeace with @unmissmedia. Read her story: https://t.co/rg64j7WzwV https://t.co/yCULRocWxZ

Only 28 million #COVID19 vaccine doses have been administered in Africa so far — that is less than 2 doses for every 100 people. 

#OnlyTogether can we overcome this pandemic — by sharing the vaccine fairly around the world. https://t.co/lsfaV8EZsU https://t.co/pWJX2GJMdG

What does it take to work for the UN in some of the world’s most difficult and dangerous situations?

In Season 3 of our podcast 'Awake At Night', @MelissaFleming speaks with extraordinary UN staff members to find out!

🔊 Listen to their powerful testimonies.

Even as #MentalHealthMonth comes to an end, the conversation about the importance of mental well-being continues.

Check out our latest @tiktok_us for ideas of healthy ways to cope during these stressful times. https://t.co/1k8sk63BB7 https://t.co/z3emamfRhB

Protecting our planet is in everyone's interest & everyone has a role to play.

#ClimateAction is not only the right thing to do, it is also the smart thing to do - creating jobs and saving money & lives. 
https://t.co/qICEEM4aqh https://t.co/7Id2u94Vtq

"Placing women & girls at the centre of our efforts & concerns will help us better protect civilians & build a more sustainable peace."

Meet Major Steplyne Nyaboga of Kenya, winner of the UN Military Gender Advocate of the Year Award. https://t.co/5YU2FoVG9r https://t.co/YFycSQitcS

Inequality, sustainability & the climate crisis have important gender dimensions that must urgently be addressed.

UN gender adviser @nahlav explains how these issues highlighted in @HandmaidsOnHulu are hitting close to home.
https://t.co/lHPc1hRqtZ

Women in @UNPeacekeeping:
☑️ Help reduce conflict 
☑️ Serve as role models
☑️ Provide greater sense of security 

On Saturday's Int'l Day of UN Peacekeepers, we salute the key role that women play in achieving lasting peace around the 🌍. https://t.co/JlWYyEQpfh #PKDay https://t.co/bB2IiDwRti

Cities are major contributors to the climate crisis, but also an important hub for #ClimateAction. 

@UNEP Young Champion of the Earth @nzambimatee_ke explains what a green future for cities could look like & how the #ParisAgreement can help us get there. https://t.co/gFheFHFwEc https://t.co/N6O1sPB04a

🕊 Young people are powerful agents of peace who can help prevent & resolve conflict. 

On Saturday's International Day of UN Peacekeepers, see how @UNPeacekeeping is supporting youth around the world to fulfill this crucial role: https://t.co/ipEvGM3zUC #PKDay https://t.co/SGYz64w1nw

There are still 17 non-self-governing territories in the world. 
Learn more about these places & their people: https://t.co/nomsytF4RK https://t.co/KnEzphq14J

Saturday is Int'l Day of UN Peacekeepers! 

More than 90,000 men & women work in 12 peacekeeping missions worldwide to:

🇺🇳 Protect civilians
🇺🇳 Help achieve & maintain peace
🇺🇳 Defend human rights & much more

We thank them for their service!

https://t.co/fOO1anhAJf #PKDay https://t.co/RFweTiTlYe

Conflict in one country can have regional & global repercussions. 

UN Peacekeepers serve in missions around the world to prevent the spread of conflict & violence. 

More on Saturday's Int'l Day of UN Peacekeepers: https://t.co/67UTXS1EIp #PKDay https://t.co/wK5fRpxdng

"The world is experiencing a growing pandemic of obesity. It affects people of all ages in all regions. Particularly concerning are the young people affected."

-- @antonioguterres on World Digestive Health Day.  

More from WHO: https://t.co/swRmMMUdmU https://t.co/i20tL4zGLq

Amid #COVID19, @UNPeacekeeping missions have helped respond to the crisis while continuing to carry out their important protection work. 

On Saturday's Int'l Day of UN Peacekeepers, we thank the men & women #ServingForPeace during this difficult time. https://t.co/USPjbF4FUz https://t.co/BoTTPvVVjp

UN humanitarians express deep concern about serious & ongoing abuses carried out against displaced civilians in Ethiopia’s Tigray region. 

Many are facing dire food insecurity after months of conflict. https://t.co/DI7AuPbQTk

Nearly 1.25 billion women & girls don't have access to a safe, private toilet, which affects how they're able to manage their periods -- and #COVID19 has worsened those challenges.

More from @UN_Women on Friday's #MenstrualHygieneDay: https://t.co/wDyrYe6sF1 via https://t.co/f390S1Mtyk

From Afghanistan to Nepal to South Sudan -- the UN supports the global pandemic response in many ways, including by helping to ensure equitable access to healthcare and life-saving #COVID19 vaccines.

Find out more in our latest @TwitterMoments: https://t.co/ecG1xAML61

Periods are just as natural as breathing.

Without periods, no one would be here.

Friday is #MenstrualHygieneDay. https://t.co/KWbrSEQHYc https://t.co/JyUn1CLLhu

Civilians caught up in conflict are #NotATarget, yet they are killed & injured in greater numbers than members of fighting forces. 

They often face additional threats, including sexual violence, mass displacement & acute hunger. 

More from @UNOCHA: https://t.co/p5I1blCaAA

Let's end the stigma around menstruation. Period. 

On Friday's #MenstrualHygieneDay & every day, @UN_Women works to safeguard the health of women & girls without stress, shame or unnecessary barriers to information or menstrual supplies. https://t.co/wDyrYe6sF1 https://t.co/qRuEp8fGsA

Menstrual health is a human right. 

Yet, menstruation can result in discrimination, stigma & exclusion against women & girls. More from @UNFPA on Friday’s #MenstrualHygieneDay: https://t.co/KWbrSF8jmM https://t.co/c3pc6plJHX

Only through negotiations that end the occupation & create a viable two-State solution can we hope to bring a definitive end to these senseless cycles of violence.

-- UN Special Coordinator for Middle East Peace Process @TWennesland to Security Council. https://t.co/OFuv7ImQsL

"We salute the dedication & bravery of all our peacekeepers – women & men, the young & the slightly older – and we remain grateful for their service & sacrifice."

-- @antonioguterres at ceremony honouring fallen UN Peacekeepers. https://t.co/unYYC9YlPY https://t.co/sm7UK5oa8t

A total investment in nature of USD 8.1 trillion is needed between now and 2050 to successfully tackle the climate, biodiversity and land degradation crises.

More from @UNEP. ⬇️ #ForNature
https://t.co/N83zKxnRso

"Unless the root causes of this violence are addressed, it will sadly be a matter of time until the next round of violence commences, with further pain & suffering." 

-- @UNHumanRights chief @mbachelet on situation between Israelis & Palestinians. https://t.co/ylfXHZKnOf

Addressing the climate emergency and limiting temperature rise is still possible, if we #ActNow.  

Every bit of warming matters. 

Every bit of #ClimateAction helps. https://t.co/X0Shwfcd3n https://t.co/LtQv3D4mgg

Young #LGBTIQ+ people are building a fearless future where everyone can be safe, heard & supported, no matter who you are or whom you love. 

See how you can help them make this future a reality: https://t.co/un4Q0ruQXj #YouthLead https://t.co/48plGQxDnP

"You cannot build peace without engaging half the world’s population.”

Take a listen 🎧 as @UNYouthEnvoy explores the important role of young people in building social cohesion and maintaining peace & security in communities. 
https://t.co/crTyGtHKtu

"This is a social movement that we have to take forward to curb the pandemic."

-- @UNICEF Representative in India @DrYasminAHaque describes how 170 million people have been vaccinated against #COVID19 in only 110 days. https://t.co/bdkAsN95Hc

Iraq is among the most vulnerable nations when it comes to the climate crisis. 

See how with support from @UNDP, the country is taking #ClimateAction & making progress in transitioning to cleaner energy sources & a more sustainable future.

https://t.co/0phU0SM5Xc

It is essential that African countries receive the financial support they need to protect their citizens and to be able to relaunch their economies.   

-- @antonioguterres at this week's #AfricaDialogueSeries. https://t.co/HtrVkJn090

UN Security Council strongly condemns arrest of President & Prime Minister of Mali, calling for the safe, immediate & unconditional release of all the officials detained.  
https://t.co/ie2QkY9cEE
